com.psddev.dari.util

Class PullThroughValue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.psddev.dari.util.PullThroughValue<T>

  • public abstract class PullThroughValue<T>
extends Object
    Holds a value that's produced and cached on demand.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PullThroughValue() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get()
      Returns the value, producing it if necessary.
      Date getLastProduce()
      Returns the last time that the value was produced.
      Date getLastProduceDate()
      Deprecated. 
      Use getLastProduce() instead.
      void invalidate()
      Invalidates all cached value.
      protected boolean isExpired(Date lastProduce)
      Called by get() to check if the cached value should be invalidated.
      boolean isProduced()
      Returns true if the value has been produced.
      protected abstract T produce()
      Called by get() to produce the value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PullThroughValue

        public PullThroughValue()

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public T get()
        Returns the value, producing it if necessary. Subsequent calls to this method will return the same cached value until it expires or has been invalidated.

      • isExpired

        protected boolean isExpired(Date lastProduce)
        Called by get() to check if the cached value should be invalidated. Default implementation always returns false, causing the cache to never invalidate.

      • produce

        protected abstract T produce()
                      throws Exception
        Called by get() to produce the value.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getLastProduce

        public Date getLastProduce()
        Returns the last time that the value was produced.
        Returns:
        May be null if the value was never produced.

      • isProduced

        public boolean isProduced()
        Returns true if the value has been produced.

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate()
        Invalidates all cached value.

      • getLastProduceDate

        @Deprecated
public Date getLastProduceDate()
        Deprecated. Use getLastProduce() instead.
